incidents.name: AI Configs Experiencing Elevated Errors

incident_updates.body: No further issues have been observed or reported related to the incident.
A fix has been implemented to address the errors when creating a new AI configuration. We will continue to monitor for the next several minutes to ensure full feature restoration.
The issue has been identified and we are working on remediation. We will send an update shortly to confirm the issue with AI Configs has been resolved.

Early access customers using the AI Configs feature are experiencing elevated errors beginning at 12:18UTC. Customers may receive an error when attempting to create a new AI configuration. We are continuing to investigate the root cause of these errors and will provide an update when available.

incidents.name: Docs Site Intermittently Unavailable

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to monitor traffic on the docs site and have scheduled time with our vendor tomorrow afternoon PT to further troubleshoot.
We are continuing to investigate the issue with our vendor. Our monitoring shows a very small portion of visitors to the docs site experienced these errors from approximately 1:10PM - 2:07PM PT.

The documentation site is experiencing intermittently long page load times. Some customers may experience HTTP 504 errors when viewing pages on the docs site. We're investigating this issue in collaboration with our vendor.

incidents.name: Teams Issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The initial fix resolved all teams issues for this incident. Permissions were not affected. There was no data loss and flag delivery was not impacted.

We have resolved the issue where some teams were not showing in the UI. Teams without members were not showing in the teams UI, all teams are displaying now. There is a related issue where teams with permissions of "No Access" are being overly restricted. We're confirming that the fix identified resolves this issue as well.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating an incident where some teams are missing from the UI. Data loss is not expected. Flag Delivery is not impacted.

incident_updates.body: The issue with missing some aggregate usage data in the account dashboards has been resolved. The backfill of missing data has completed and the impacted services have returned to normal operation. There was no data loss experienced.

The backfill of missing account usage charts data is still in progress. We have backfilled most data, but small portion still remains. We expect the process to complete within the next day. We will post another update and resolve this incident once the backfill is fully completed.

The issue with missing some aggregate usage data in the account dashboards has been identified and a fix has been implemented. We are in the process of backfilling the missing data. We will post another update and resolve this incident once the backfill process is completed.

We have identified the issue with customer account dashboards missing some usage aggregate data since Dec 20. There is no data loss. We are working on the fix and will post an update once issue is resolved.

Service operation is not impacted, the issue is limited to account usage charts.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

All customers are experiencing the missing percentage rollout option from the Serve dropdown in the feature flag rule edit page. 

Feature flags that are not using percentage rollout or already have the percentage rollout can still be created or edited. Percentage rollout in a rule can still be created via API. 

We have identified the issue and are working on a fix. We will provide updates as they become available.

affected_components.name: Feature management (non-core functionality) - Flag usage metrics

incident_updates.body: The issue has been identified as a problem with an upstream provider. We are working to deploy a fix that will restore access for affected Foundation Monthly customers. Other feature loss includes: self-serve billing changes, and usage dashboard availability for all customers.

affected_components.name: Feature management (non-core functionality) - Flag usage metrics

incident_updates.body: We have identified the issue and are working on a fix. Foundation monthly users are unable to login or navigate the UI.
This issue may be affecting some users ability to log in, we're continuing to investigate
We are currently investigating an issue happening when some users are viewing subscription information.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: UI error when toggling a flag from the legacy flag list

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

For users on the legacy UI only, toggling the flag on or off from the flag list is resulting in an error. Flags can still be toggled on or off from the individual flag view.

We have identified the problem and are working to resolve the issue.
